result.execSummary:
The defendant Teddy Leroy Ruport was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.
Pay as required by Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teddy Leroy Ruport

records.addlTxt:
11:24 AM Defendant Teddy Leroy Ruport in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Teddy Leroy Ruport.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that Count 1 to be amended to 961.41(3g)(d) Possession of Amphetamine. For amended charge, 90 days jail imposed and stayed for 1 year probation. If revoked, consecutive to any other sentence. Conditions of probation include serve 3 days jail with credit for 3 days, pay a $10 fine plus costs and comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the Dept of Corrections. Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Hoffman stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for amended charge, 90 days jail imposed and stayed for 1 year probation. If revoked, consecutive to any other sentence. Conditions of probation include serve 3 days jail with credit for 3 days, pay a $10 fine plus costs and comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the Dept of Corrections.

11:32 AM Defendant Teddy Leroy Ruport in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Teddy Leroy Ruport.  Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Notes that there has not yet been a proposal from the state. Asks for another status.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:24 AM Defendant Teddy Leroy Ruport in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Teddy Leroy Ruport.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests status 45 days out.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:

Court quashes warrant and reinstates bail/bond. Attorney La Lor not opposed to bond and conditions. Court reinstates bond and conditions. Defendant qualifies for counsel.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 11:15 am.

3:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Teddy Leroy Ruport not in court. State has no information and requests warrant and forfeiture of bail/bond. Court reviews notice of hearing for today signed. Court orders warrant and forfeiture of bail/bond.

Defendant waives time limits.  Court accepts as freely given. Court resets preliminary hearing and status check.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Not guilty plea(s) entered. 
State requests 1000sb, no drugs.
Attorney no objection.
